places.name: Ganges
places.description: The Ganges is a river in Asia running through India and Bangladesh. It is part of the third largest river on earth.

places.name: River Severn
places.description: At 220 miles long, the longest river in Great Britain.

places.name: River Avon
places.description: The River Avon in central England flows generally south-westwards and is a major left-bank tributary of the River Severn.

places.name: Glenarm
places.description: Glenarm, a village and castle in County Antrim, Northern Ireland. Davy wrote a poem called 'Glenarm', dated August 1806.

places.name: Cyprus
places.description: Cyprus is the third largest and third-most populous island in the Mediterranean. It is east of Greece, north of Egypt, south of Turkey, and west of Lebanon and Syria. Cyprus occupies an important role in Greek mythology, being the birthplace of Aphrodite and Adonis, and home to King Cinyras, Teucer and Pygmalion.

places.name: Athens
places.description: Athens is the capital city of Greece.

places.name: Athens
places.description: Athens is the capital city of Greece.

places.name: Arakil
places.description: Arokil is the Errigal mountain of the same range; the handwriting on page 69 in notebook 15B was reproduced by John Davy along with the poem 'Mucrish and Arokil, ye pair...' in Tait's Edinburgh Magazine for 1836, vol. iii, p. 252. See also Memoirs, vol. 1, pp. 287 ff.

places.name: Mucrish
places.description: Muckish, one of the Derryveagh Mountains. See the poem 'Mucrish and Arokil, ye pair...' in Tait's Edinburgh Magazine for 1836, vol. iii, p. 252. See also Memoirs, vol. 1, pp. 287 ff.

persons.name: Louis BernardGuyton de Morveau
persons.description: French chemist and revolutionary politician who is credited with producing the first systematic method of chemical nomenclature. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: LuigiGalvani
persons.description: Italian surgeon and anatomist who carried out experiments with electricity and animals. The term 'galvanism' was named after him to refer to the generation of electric current by chemical action.

persons.name: WilliamClayfield
persons.description: A Bristol man of science and a colleague of Davy's at the Medical Pneumatic Institution.

persons.name: HenryClutterbuck
persons.description: English medical writer especiially on fever.

places.name: Chimboraco
places.description: Now spelled Chimborazo. An inactive stratovolcano situated in the Cordillera Occidental range of the Andes in Ecuador.

places.name: Cotopaxi
places.description: Cotopaxi is an active stratovolcano in the Andes Mountains, in Ecuador. The first European to climb it was Alexander Von Humboldt in 1802.

places.name: Cotopaxi
places.description: Cotopaxi is an active stratovolcano in the Andes Mountains, in Ecuador. The first European to climb it was Alexander Von Humboldt in 1802.

places.name: Quito
places.description: Quito, Ecuador's capital, sits high in the Andean foothills at an altitude of 2,850m. It is constructed on the foundations of an ancient Incan city.

places.name: Cotopaxi
places.description: Cotopaxi is an active stratovolcano in the Andes Mountains, in Ecuador. The first European to climb it was Alexander Von Humboldt in 1802.

places.name: Quito
places.description: Quito, Ecuador's capital, sits high in the Andean foothills at an altitude of 2,850m. It is constructed on the foundations of an ancient Incan city.

persons.name: HenryWarburton
persons.description: A member of the Animal Chemistry Club, the Chemical Club, and the Geological Society of London, and a sporting friend of Davy's. FRSL.

persons.name: IsaacNewton
persons.description: Prominent English natural philosopher and mathematician greatly admired by Davy who once under the influence of several litres of nitrous oxide wrote in his notebook 'Davy & Newton' in one inch letters. FRSL.

persons.name: JamesStodart
persons.description: British surgical instrument maker; experimented on steel with Michael Faraday. FRSL.

persons.name: Edward CharlesHoward
persons.description: A brother of the Duke of Norfolk, he became a chemist, discovering the explosive properties of mercury fulminate. FRSL

persons.name: CharlesRoyce
persons.description: Assisted Royal Institution lecturers, including Davy, bewteen 1802 and 1808.

persons.name: LuigiGalvani
persons.description: Italian surgeon and anatomist who carried out experiments with electricity and animals. The term 'galvanism' was named after him to refer to the generation of electric current by chemical action.
